verses.kjv: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.
verses.ct: Be careful not to practice your generosity in front of others just to get their attention. If you do, you will have no reward from your Father in heaven.

verses.kjv: Therefore when thou doest thine alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
verses.ct: So when you give to those in need, don't announce it with fanfare the way hypocrites do in the synagogues and on the streets, hoping to win people's admiration. Truly I tell you, they have already received their reward.

verses.kjv: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:
verses.ct: Instead, when you give to others, do it so quietly that your left hand doesn't even know what your right hand is doing.

verses.kjv: That thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.
verses.ct: Keep your giving private. Your Father, who sees what is done in private, will reward you publicly.

verses.kjv: And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
verses.ct: When you pray, don't act like the hypocrites. They love standing up in synagogues and on street corners to pray so that everyone will notice them. Truly I tell you, they have already received their reward.

verses.kjv: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.
verses.ct: Instead, when you pray, go into your room, close the door, and pray to your Father who is unseen. Your Father, who sees what is done in private, will reward you publicly.

verses.kjv: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen do: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.
verses.ct: When you pray, don't ramble on with empty words the way pagans do. They think God will hear them because of their many words.

verses.kjv: Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.
verses.ct: Don't be like them, because your Father already knows what you need before you even ask him.

verses.kjv: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.
verses.ct: This is how you should pray: 'Our Father in heaven, may your name be honored as holy.

verses.kjv: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven.
verses.ct: May your kingdom come. May your will be carried out on earth just as it is in heaven.

verses.kjv: Give us this day our daily bread.
verses.ct: Give us today the food we need for the day.

verses.kjv: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.
verses.ct: Forgive us our debts, just as we have forgiven those who owe us.

verses.kjv: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.
verses.ct: Don't lead us into temptation, but rescue us from evil. For the kingdom, the power, and the glory belong to you forever. Amen.'

verses.kjv: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:
verses.ct: If you forgive others when they wrong you, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

verses.kjv: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
verses.ct: But if you refuse to forgive others for their wrongs, your Father will not forgive your wrongs either.

verses.kjv: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
verses.ct: When you fast, don't put on a gloomy expression like the hypocrites do. They make themselves look miserable so that everyone can tell they're fasting. Truly I tell you, they have already received their reward.

verses.kjv: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;
verses.ct: Instead, when you fast, wash your face and style your hair as usual,

verses.kjv: That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.
verses.ct: so that no one will know you're fasting except your Father, who is unseen. Your Father, who sees what is done in private, will reward you publicly.

verses.kjv: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:
verses.ct: Don't stockpile wealth for yourselves here on earth, where moths and rust destroy it and where thieves break in and steal it.

verses.kjv: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:
verses.ct: Instead, store up wealth for yourselves in heaven, where moths and rust can't destroy it and where thieves can't break in and steal it.

verses.kjv: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
verses.ct: Because wherever your treasure is, that's where your heart will be too.

verses.kjv: The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.
verses.ct: The eye is the lamp of the body. If your eye is healthy, your whole body will be filled with light.

verses.kjv: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!
verses.ct: But if your eye is unhealthy, your whole body will be filled with darkness. And if the light inside you is actually darkness, how deep that darkness is!

verses.kjv: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
verses.ct: Nobody can serve 2 masters. You'll end up hating one and loving the other, or being devoted to one and despising the other. You cannot serve both God and money.

verses.kjv: Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?
verses.ct: That's why I'm telling you: stop worrying about your life — what you'll eat or drink — or about your body — what you'll wear. Isn't life about more than food, and the body about more than clothing?

verses.kjv: Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?
verses.ct: Look at the birds. They don't plant seeds, harvest crops, or store grain in barns, yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren't you far more valuable than they are?

verses.kjv: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?
verses.ct: Can any of you add a single moment to your life by worrying about it?

verses.kjv: And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:
verses.ct: And why do you worry about clothing? Think about how the wildflowers grow. They don't work hard or make their own fabric,

verses.kjv: And yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
verses.ct: yet I tell you that not even Solomon in all his glory was dressed as beautifully as one of them.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith?
verses.ct: So if God dresses the wild grass so beautifully — grass that is here today and thrown into a fire tomorrow — won't he take much better care of you? Your faith is so small!

verses.kjv: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?
verses.ct: So stop worrying and asking, 'What will we eat?' or 'What will we drink?' or 'What will we wear?'

verses.kjv: (For after all these things do the Gentiles seek:) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.
verses.ct: People who don't know God chase after all these things, but your heavenly Father already knows you need every one of them.

verses.kjv: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
verses.ct: Instead, make the kingdom of God and his righteousness your top priority, and all these things will be provided for you as well.

verses.kjv: Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.
verses.ct: So don't worry about tomorrow, because tomorrow will have its own concerns. Each day has enough trouble of its own.
